body: pulled from #5 @piling --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/toxcore/6)

comment_regular_data.body: This makes no sense. Asserts are for debug builds, not release. That length check always needs to be made, and there's no reason to abort in a release build because it fails.

@JFreegman the check is made by every single one of the callers

 @iphydf
@GrayHatter No it's not, but it shouldn't matter either way. Either the function needs to check if the value is zero, or it doesn't. Removing a boundary check but adding an assert is schizophrenic.
I highly recommend reading this: http://blog.regehr.org/archives/1091

> @GrayHatter No it's not,

@JFreegman what fxn calls encrypt_data_symmetric() without first checking the length?

commit.message: This is not right place to check for length
